network

Class LoginPacket

  • java.lang.Object
    • network.LoginPacket
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    LogoutPacket, RequestLoginPacket, ResponseLoginPacket

    public abstract class LoginPacket
extends java.lang.Object
    An abstract class representing all the packets sent to handle login changes, connections and disconnections.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private java.net.InetAddress sourceAddress
      The source address of the packet.

    • Constructor Summary

      LoginPacket() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      protected abstract java.lang.String getDataToSend()
      Serialization abstract method used to convert this packet to a string that is to be sent over the network.
      protected java.lang.String getFlag()
      Get the type of this packet as a three letters flag.
      protected java.net.InetAddress getSourceAddress()
      Get the source address of this packet.
      protected static LoginPacket receivePacket(java.net.DatagramSocket udpSocket)
      Deserialization method used to rebuild a login packet from data received on a socket.
      protected void sendPacket(java.net.DatagramSocket udpSocket, java.net.InetAddress destinationAddress)
      Send the packet over the network to an IP address using an UDP socket.

    • Method Detail

      • getSourceAddress

        protected java.net.InetAddress getSourceAddress()
        Get the source address of this packet.
        Returns:
        the source address of this packet

      • getFlag

        protected java.lang.String getFlag()
        Get the type of this packet as a three letters flag.
        Returns:
        the flag of this packet

      • receivePacket

        protected static LoginPacket receivePacket(java.net.DatagramSocket udpSocket)
        Deserialization method used to rebuild a login packet from data received on a socket. The login packet created must be cast to the right type. To know this type, the "getFlag" method must be used.
        Parameters:
        udpSocket - the UDP socket you want to listen on for incoming packets.
        Returns:
        a login packet.

      • getDataToSend

        protected abstract java.lang.String getDataToSend()
        Serialization abstract method used to convert this packet to a string that is to be sent over the network.
        Returns:
        the serialized packet

      • sendPacket

        protected void sendPacket(java.net.DatagramSocket udpSocket,
                          java.net.InetAddress destinationAddress)
        Send the packet over the network to an IP address using an UDP socket.
        Parameters:
        udpSocket - the UDP socket you want to use to send the packet over the network
        destinationAddress - the destination IP address
